name: ComfyUI Qwen Image Edit - Blackwell Ready
description: ComfyUI with Qwen Image Edit Rapid models, optimized for RTX 5090 (Blackwell) and Ada GPUs. Models downloaded on first run (~38 GB). Python 3.12, CUDA 12.8 build (forward-compatible with CUDA 13.0 runtime). Includes Jupyter, FileBrowser, SSH.
readme:
# ComfyUI Qwen Image Edit - Blackwell Ready

## Quick Start

**First Startup Time**: ~15-20 minutes (downloads ~38 GB models)
**Subsequent Startups**: ~2-3 minutes

1. Pod will launch, download models (first run), and run health checks
2. Access services at:
   - **ComfyUI**: `http://<pod-ip>:8188` (main interface)
   - **Jupyter**: `http://<pod-ip>:8888` (data analysis/scripts)
   - **FileBrowser**: `http://<pod-ip>:8080` (file management)
   - **SSH**: `ssh root@<pod-ip>` (terminal access, port 22)

## Pre-Configured

✅ **All 3 Qwen models auto-downloaded on first run**:
- Checkpoint: Qwen-Rapid-AIO-NSFW-v11.4 (28.4 GB)
- Text Encoder: qwen_2.5_vl_7b_fp8_scaled (9.38 GB)
- VAE: qwen_image_vae (254 MB)

✅ **Python 3.12 + CUDA 12.8 build** (forward-compatible with CUDA 13.0 runtime)

✅ **Custom Nodes**: ComfyUI-Manager, VideoHelperSuite, KJNodes, Civicomfy

## GPU Support

- ✅ **RTX 5090** (Blackwell, sm_120) - Select CUDA 13.0 on RunPod
- ✅ **RTX 4090** (Ada, sm_89) - Fully compatible
- ✅ **A100** (Ampere, sm_80) - Compatible

## Customize

**Disable Jupyter on startup**:
```bash
ENABLE_JUPYTER=0
```

**Enable Debug logs**:
```bash
DEBUG=1
```

## Troubleshooting

**GPU not detected?**
- Inside pod: `nvidia-smi` and `python3 -c "import torch; print(torch.cuda.is_available())"`

**Models missing?**
- Models download on first startup via aria2c (~15 min)
- Check: `ls -lh /workspace/ComfyUI/models/checkpoints/`

---

**Repository**: https://github.com/ameyapb/comfyui-blackwell
